result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Gregory B Moreno was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 15 hours community service per week.
Maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Psychological evaluation and follow through.  Cognitive thinking program.  Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department.  Alcohol monitoring as the Dept. deems appropriate including random UA's.  

DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: with huber for work/school/treatment if deft qualifies to start immediately.

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 2:33 pm 
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher; Deft appears in person with Atty Rick Cveykus. 
COURT notes PSI and alternate PSI. 
State notes amended PSI. 
OTR: 2:35 pm BOTR: 2:46 pm 
COURT notes review of amended PSI. 
Parties have reviewed amended PSI and alternate PSI. 
Atty Cveykus notes he was missing page 8 and the State provided copy of that missing page. 
J.J. sworn and testifies. 
Argument by Atty Cveykus. 
Deft makes statement. 
COURT makes findings.
 
COURT ORDERS: On Ct. 1>>5 years imprisonment - 2.5 years IC and 2.5 years ES - STAYED for 5 years probation. 
COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of probation: 1 year MCJ with huber for work/school/treatment if deft qualifies to start immediately; $1200 plus costs; 5 years dl revocation; 5 years IID; psychological evaluation and follow through; AODA and follow through; cognitive thinking program; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; alcohol monitoring as the dept deems appropriate including random UAs; maintain fullitme employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 15 hours CS per week; DNA sample/surchrage. 
COURT finds the deft entitled to 254 days sentence credit. 
COURT finds the deft eligible for CIP and SAP. 

COURT allows parties to retain their copies of PSI, amended PSI, and alternate PSI and reminds them to keep them confidential.
